alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:34PM EST until December 18 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN PENOBSCOT AND SOUTHWESTERN PISCATAQUIS COUNTIES... At 434 PM EST, Gauge reports indicated that heavy rain was falling in the Piscataquis River basin near Blanchard, causing rapidly rising waters. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inches in 3 hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...River and rain gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, streets, and other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Frenchtown, Sangerville, Garland, Parkman, Abbot, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Beaver Cove, Bowerbank, Kingsbury and Onawa. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 3 HOURS
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
